meanings.sent1: The aberrant behavior of the student caught the teacher's attention.
meanings.sent2: Her aberrant choice of clothing raised a few eyebrows at the party.
meanings.sent3: It was aberrant for the cat to bark like a dog.
meanings.sent4: The aberrant weather patterns made planning the picnic difficult.
meanings.sent5: The aberrant glow of the moon cast an eerie light over the forest.

meanings.definition: Deviating from the normal or usual course
meanings.sent1: The aberrant path through the woods led them astray.
meanings.sent2: The aberrant growth of the plant puzzled the botanist.
meanings.sent3: The aberrant dance moves of the penguin entertained the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her aberrant sense of humor always kept her friends guessing.
meanings.sent5: The aberrant melody of the song lingered in his mind long after it ended.
